events.originalText: Two people were killed and eight others wounded when a rejected asylum seeker went on a knife rampage in Turku, Finland.
events.subtitle: 2017 Turku attack
events.headline: Rejected asylum seeker goes on knife rampage in Turku, Finland, killing two

events.originalText: Pakistani president Pervez Musharraf resigned under pressure from a movement to impeach him.
events.subtitle: Pervez Musharraf
events.headline: Pervez Musharraf resigns as Pakistani president under pressure

events.originalText: Hurricane Alicia made landfall near Galveston, Texas, causing $3 billion in damage and 21 fatalities.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Alicia
events.headline: Hurricane Alicia causes $3 billion in damage and 21 fatalities near Galveston, Texas

events.originalText: Vietnam War: Members of the 6th Battalion of the Royal Australian Regiment were surrounded by a much larger Viet Cong unit at the Battle of Long Tan, but held them off for several hours until reinforcements arrived.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Australian troops hold off Viet Cong at Battle of Long Tan

events.originalText: East German Communist Party member Hildegard Trabant was killed while attempting to cross the Berlin Wall.
events.subtitle: Socialist Unity Party of Germany
events.headline: East German Communist Party member killed while crossing Berlin Wall

events.originalText: Australia won the fifth Test of the 1948 Ashes series, becoming the first Test cricket team to go undefeated in England, earning them the nickname "The Invincibles".
events.subtitle: Fifth Test, 1948 Ashes series
events.headline: Australia wins fifth Test of 1948 Ashes series, remains undefeated in England

events.originalText: World War II: Amid a Soviet invasion of Japanese-held Sakhalin, Japanese police massacred 18 Koreans in Kamishisuka.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese police massacre 18 Koreans in Kamishisuka during Soviet invasion of Sakhalin

events.originalText: Second World War: During the Battle of Britain, the Luftwaffe made an all-out effort to destroy RAF Fighter Command, with both sides combined losing more aircraft on this day than at any other point during the campaign.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Luftwaffe makes all-out effort to destroy RAF Fighter Command during Battle of Britain

events.originalText: The Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution  was ratified, guaranteeing women's suffrage in the country.
events.subtitle: Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution
events.headline: Nineteenth Amendment ratified, guaranteeing women's suffrage in the US

events.originalText: Russian Civil War: British motor torpedo boats raided the Bolshevik Baltic Fleet's home base of Kronstadt, sinking a depot ship  and damaging a battleship.
events.subtitle: Russian Civil War
events.headline: British motor torpedo boats raid Bolshevik Baltic Fleet's home base, sinking depot ship

events.originalText: A hurricane struck the Caribbean island of Martinique, killing about 700 people, injuring at least 1,000 others, and causing severe damage.
events.subtitle: 1891 Martinique hurricane
events.headline: Hurricane strikes Martinique, killing about 700 people and causing severe damage

events.originalText: American astronomer Asaph Hall discovered Phobos, the larger of Mars's two moons, six days after discovering Deimos, the smaller one.
events.subtitle: Asaph Hall
events.headline: Asaph Hall discovers Phobos, the larger moon of Mars

events.originalText: American Civil War: At the Battle of Globe Tavern, Union forces attempted to sever the Weldon Railroad during the Siege of Petersburg.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union forces attempt to sever Weldon Railroad at Battle of Globe Tavern during American Civil War

events.originalText: A meteor procession blazed across the night sky over Great Britain.
events.subtitle: Meteor procession
events.headline: Meteor procession blazes across night sky over Great Britain

events.originalText: The trials of the Pendle and Samlesbury witches (statue pictured), among the most famous of England's witch trials, began at the assizes in Lancaster.
events.subtitle: Pendle witches
events.headline: Trials of Pendle and Samlesbury witches begin at assizes in Lancaster

events.originalText: John White, governor of the Roanoke Colony, the first English settlement in North America (located in present-day North Carolina), returned after a three-year absence to find it deserted (depicted).
events.subtitle: John White (colonist and artist)
events.headline: Governor John White returns to Roanoke Colony to find it deserted after three-year absence

events.originalText: John White, governor of the Roanoke Colony, the first English settlement in North America (located in present-day North Carolina), returned after a three-year absence to find it deserted (depicted).
events.subtitle: John White (colonist and artist)
events.headline: Catholic Monarchs of Spain conquer city of Málaga from Emirate of Granada after four-month siege

events.originalText: Reconquista: After a four-month siege, the Catholic Monarchs of Spain conquered the city of Málaga from the Emirate of Granada.
events.subtitle: Reconquista
events.headline: Umayyad partisans defeat supporters of Abd Allah ibn al-Zubayr near Damascus during Second Fitna

events.originalText: Second Fitna: Umayyad partisans defeated the supporters of Abd Allah ibn al-Zubayr near Damascus, cementing Umayyad control of Syria.
events.subtitle: Second Fitna
